Topic: Draw two habitats and the different living things in each
Evidence Statements: The student can draw two different habitats, one on land (like a playground, garden, or forest) and one in water (such as a pond or stream).
The student can include different types of living things in the land habitat, such as trees, bushes, and animals like squirrels or ants.
The student can show various living things in the water habitat, like fish, clams, or plants that grow in water.
The student can compare the diversity of plants and animals found in the two habitats by illustrating them side by side.
The student can identify and label patterns observed in the types of living things in each habitat.
